org.xchain.framework.sax

Class CommandHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.xchain.framework.sax.CommandHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.xml.sax.ContentHandler, org.xml.sax.DTDHandler, org.xml.sax.ext.LexicalHandler
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CommandXmlReader.CommandHandlerImpl

    public abstract class CommandHandler
extends java.lang.Object
implements org.xml.sax.ContentHandler, org.xml.sax.DTDHandler, org.xml.sax.ext.LexicalHandler
    This handler provides caching and translation services for command based sax sources. The following features are implemented: 1) Attributes can be assigned after a startElement event by calling attribute( String namespace, String localName, String qName ); 2) The handler can be set into comment mode, which will translate all calls into comments. 3) The handler can be flushed, to force all outstanding events to the content handler. This will be a partial flush when in comment mode, since comments are passed in one call, instead of many. Modes: 1) Standard mode. 2) Element building mode. 2.1) Attribute building mode. 3) Comment building mode. Element building is terminated by: 1) A text event (characters or ignorable whitespace.) 2) Another start element event. 3) A processing instruction. 4) An end element event. Attribute building is terminated by: 1) An end attribute event. Comment building is terminated by: 1) an end comment event.
    Author:
    Mike Moulton, Devon Tackett, Christian Trimble, Jason Rose, Josh Kennedy

      • comment

        public void comment(char[] comment,
           int offset,
           int length)
             throws org.xml.sax.SAXException
        Adds a comment to this handler. If the handler is in comment mode, then an escaped comment will be added to the sax stream, otherwise a standard comment is passed on.
        Specified by:
        comment in interface org.xml.sax.ext.LexicalHandler
        Parameters:
        comment - the character array containing the comment.
        offset - the offset into the array to start the characters.
        length - the length of the comment starting at the offset.
        Throws:
        org.xml.sax.SAXException

      • comment

        public void comment(java.lang.String comment)
             throws org.xml.sax.SAXException
        Adds a comment to this handler. This method turns the comment string into a character array then calls comment(char[], int, int).
        Parameters:
        comment - the text of the comment.
        Throws:
        org.xml.sax.SAXException

      • startComment

        public void startComment()
                  throws org.xml.sax.SAXException
        Starts a comment section. While in a comment section, all events are translated into a comment, to be passed on once the comment section ends.
        Throws:
        org.xml.sax.SAXException

      • endComment

        public void endComment()
                throws org.xml.sax.SAXException
